Selected Answer: C
C. Escalate to senior management.

Escalating the issue to senior management allows for a higher-level decision-making process. Senior management can evaluate the situation, consider the potential risks, and make an informed decision regarding whether to adjust the business objective, allocate additional resources, seek exceptions or waivers from the security standard, or take other appropriate actions. After senior management is aware of the issue and involved in the decision-making process, they may then decide to perform a cost-benefit analysis, revisit the business objective, or recommend risk acceptance if necessary.

comments.content: I am not a 100% sure if C is the answer but I don't think alternative controls and compensating controls are the same thing. Alternative control mean other controls than the one currently suggested or implemented. Compensating control are additional controls implemented to make the already implemented control work or more efficient. In this case it can be something like forcing the users to not bypass the implemented control using additional technical controls.

questions.question_text: A business unit is not complying with a control implemented to mitigate risk because doing so impacts the ability to achieve business goals. When reporting the noncompliance to senior management, what would be the information security manager's BEST recommendation?
Which of the following is MOST helpful for protecting an enterprise from advanced persistent threats (APTs)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Threat intelligence
For protecting an enterprise from advanced persistent threats (APTs), threat intelligence is the most helpful option. Threat intelligence provides valuable information about potential threats, including APTs, their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), and indicators of compromise (IOCs). By leveraging threat intelligence, organizations can proactively identify and respond to APTs before they cause significant damage. While options A, B, and C (updated security policies, regular antivirus updates, defined security standards) are important components of a comprehensive security strategy, threat intelligence specifically focuses on understanding and mitigating advanced threats like APTs.

Selected Answer: D
D. Threat intelligence

Selected Answer: D
Which of the following should be the PRIMARY consideration when DEVELOPING an incident response plan?

The operative word is developing (and not implementing). 

For developing, it is critical to make a clear distinction between event, incident, problem and disaster. This is required to establish the roles and responsibilities, severity and escalation procedures. 

If the question were about implementation, then management support would have been a precursor to execution of the IRP.

Selected Answer: D
The definition of an incident will determine the scope of the incident response plan and the types of incidents that it will cover. It is important to define an incident broadly enough to capture all potential incidents, but narrowly enough to focus on the most important incidents.
B. Management Support. Regardless if you have a well developed plan, but management isn't committed to supporting incident response initiatives, this will all be pointless.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be the PRIMARY consideration when developing an incident response plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Validate the applicability of the regulation.

Before taking any other action, it is crucial to determine whether the regulation applies to your organization. This involves understanding the specific requirements and scope of the regulation to assess if it pertains to your industry, organization size, and geographic location. Once you confirm the applicability, you can then proceed with the other actions like monitoring industry response, seeking legal counsel, and escalating compliance risks to senior management, as needed.

Selected Answer: C
C. Validate the applicability of the regulation.
